title: Cheers and jeers: Scenes from the Miami courthouse where Trump was arraigned
description: Largely peaceful protests as Donald Trump was arraigned in Miami Tuesday devolved into a brief flurry of chaos when a protester ran after his motorcade.

title: Supporters sing 'Happy Birthday' to Trump at Cuban restaurant after arraignment
description: Supporters sang “Happy Birthday” to former President Donald Trump at Miami's popular Cuban restaurant Versailles after he pleaded not guilty to federal charges in his handling of classified documents.

title: Cormac McCarthy, Pulitzer-winning novelist known for apocalyptic Westerns, dies at 89
description: Cormac McCarthy, the masterful prose stylist and Pulitzer Prize-winning author who plumbed the depths of violence and vengeance, has died.

title: Ohio Republican Vance will hold Justice Dept. nominees in Senate over Trump case
description: Sen. JD Vance will put a procedural hold on Department of Justice nominees in response to the prosecution of former President Donald Trump.

title: Starbucks denies union's accusation of banning Pride decorations
description: Starbucks’ workers union accused the company of banning decorations for LGBTQ Pride month. The company says that's not the case.

title: Trump waves as he arrives to Miami federal courthouse
description: Former President Donald Trump waved from his car as he arrived at the federal courthouse in Miami to be arraigned in the classified documents case.

title: Trump departs for arraignment at Miami federal court
description: Former President Trump has departed his Doral residence for his arraignment at a Miami federal courthouse. He faces charges from the special counsel investigation into his handling of classified documents. NBC News' Laura Jarrett and Hallie Jackson report.

title: U.S. government buys data on Americans with little oversight, report finds
description: U.S. intelligence agencies are buying and storing personal information on Americans with little oversight and few guidelines, according to a government report.

title: Find trails to hike, bands to see and more with these apps
description: From cocktail recipes to discovering new hiking trails, Kristopher Juniel, host of USA Today’s “Problem Solved,” shares the perfect apps to get the most out of summer.

title: The Beatles will release a new and 'final record' this year — with a little help from A.I.
description: It's the news fans of the Fab Four thought they would never see: The Beatles will release a new song this year featuring vocals from John Lennon, with a little help from artificial intelligence, Paul McCartney said Tuesday.

title: 9 people injured in Denver shooting amid Nuggets celebrations, police say
description: Nine people were injured, with three in critical condition, after an overnight shooting in an area of Denver where basketball fans had been celebrating the Nuggets' historic NBA title, authorities said early Tuesday.

title: The investigation into Trump's handling of classified documents: A timeline of events
description: Here is a timeline of how Trump became indicted for the mishandling of classified documents. He is the first U.S. president in history to face federal charges.

title: 'Outright lie': India denies Dorsey's claims it threatened to shut down Twitter
description: India threatened to shut Twitter down unless it complied with orders to restrict accounts critical of the government’s handling of farmer protests, co-founder Jack Dorsey said, an accusation Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government called an “outright lie.”

title: For China’s LGBTQ community, safe spaces are becoming harder to find
description: The Beijing LGBT Center is among the latest organizations to shut down amid a crackdown on advocacy groups by Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Trump to appear in federal court in Florida in classified documents case
description: President Donald Trump is set to appear Tuesday in federal court in Miami to face charges he misled investigators and mishandled the country’s secrets.

title: Garth Brooks addresses 'stir' over saying his bar will serve Bud Light
description: Country Music star Garth Brooks on Monday addressed critics after he said his bar would serve Bud Light and other comments, and again said he wants customers to show tolerance.

title: 22 U.S. service members injured in helicopter incident in Syria
description: Twenty-two U.S. service members were injured Sunday in a “helicopter mishap” in northeastern Syria, U.S.

title: Denver Nuggets take home first NBA championship with 94-89 win against Miami Heat
description: Nikola Jokic guided Denver to its first NBA title in team history Monday night, as the Nuggets overcame dreadful shooting and a late flurry from Miami’s Jimmy Butler to squeeze past the Heat for a frantic 94-89 victory in Game 5.
